title: Hextex chests: Reseting the champions that got boxes on s6
body:
I had a hard time putting the title so in case its not clear, every champion can obtain 1 hextex chest, and they can't get any more chests, slowly limiting the champions you can get a new chest on. After a season, a player who tries to get chests probably has around 40~ champions that can't get the chest on. I read somewhere that this limitation was reseted after a season, making every champion able to get chests again, but I'm not sure, and since this point wasn't addressed during the patch notes, I'd like if someone cleared that up for me.

Thanks in advance.

replies.body:
There's not a confirmed *date* when the refresh for chest-eligibility will reset, but it's supposed to happen with the 2017 Season, so it can't be that far off. You can find our announcement regarding how the 2017 Season will work [here.](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/competitive/how-rank-2017-season)

I'm sorry I couldn't be specific with my answer, but let me know if you have any other questions.
Yes, this is limit does reset each season, and will likely be reset at the start of patch 7.1, as BcooksEatsA stated.
I remember them saying when hextech was announced that it would reset, my guess would be once season 7 starts. Even though this is pre-season 7 the patch is still 6.22 as opposed to 7.1
